title: Chris Yuhan Liu
text:
Welcome to my homepage!
I am Chris Liu (he/him/his), a second-year statistics & data science student at California Polytechnic State University in beautiful San Luis Obispo.
I am interested in statistical computing, data visualisation, casual inference, pedagogy, and much more. Currently, I am a research assistant with Dr. Saba Gerami, where I create and expand upon theoretical frameworks for analysing student understanding in calculus.
Outside of academia, I enjoy reading classic novels, cooking new foods, and being outdoors. I am currently reading Nikolai Gogol’s Dead Souls. Let me know if you have any book recommendations!
Feel free to contact me about anything via email!

title: Debut Blog
text:
This is the first time in a while where I have written purely for the joy of it.
I find myself curious about a number of subjects. Conveying my interest with words is not the only form of expression. I hope to write, not to be judged by a reader, but for my own fulfillment.
As I write my first blog of 2025, I am overwhelmed with endless responsibilites. So forgive me if my blogs are few.
Chris

title: Blog
text:
